title: The CCC Gets Down: Karaoke
description: Come release some stress, sing a song and cheer on your community at this gathering. Snacks provided and back-up dancers encouraged.
location: Asian Pacific Islander Student Resource Center, Second Floor, University-Student Union

title: R.A.D. Women's Self-Defense Education
description: Rape Aggression Defense (R.A.D.) is a course that consists of 12 hours of instruction covering risk reduction and avoidance, basic hands-on defense training and a dynamic simulation exercise. You may register in person with the Cal State LA Department of Public Safety or the community sub-station in student housing or you can register online . For participants requiring special accommodations or with questions about the program, please contact the Crime Prevention Office at (323) 343-6290.

title: Spring Into Giving: March Food Drive
description: Spring into giving by donating nonperishable food items to the University Food Pantry on Mondays from 11 a.m. to 1 p.m. and 3 to 5 p.m. during our March food drive running until March 25. For more information, visit the food pantry webpage.
location: University-Student Union, Third Floor, Food Pantry

title: Native American Heritage Series: Tribal Justice
description: Two formidable Native American women, both chief judges in their tribe’s courts, strive to reduce incarceration rates and heal their people by restoring rather than punishing offenders. Directed by Anne Makepeace, 2017, 87 minutes.
location: U-SU Theatre, First Floor, University-Student Union

title: Film Screening and Q&A: Mujeres Luz
description: Join the Cross Cultural Centers for a screening of the film Mujeres Luz , followed by a Q&A with the director. Celebrate the brave and generous women of Veracruz, Mexico, who feed migrants traveling north. Directed by Arturo González Villaseñor, 2018, 90 minutes.
location: U-SU Theatre, First Floor, University-Student Union

title: NSS Alumni Panel
description: Join the ASI NSS College representatives for a special College of Natural & Social Sciences alumni panel. Ask questions and gain new perspectives while networking with student leaders and notable alumni.
location: University-Student Union Theatre, First Floor, University-Student Union

title: Wellness Week: Beyond Basic: Connecting Students to the Eight Dimensions of Wellness
description: This four-hour program aims to equip Cal State LA student leaders with specific campus resources related to the eight dimensions of wellness, starting with a focus on food and housing security needs. Going “Beyond Basic” is an approach that will empower participants to incorporate the information gained into their day-to-day work and serve as powerful student wellness advocates. Lunch is provided. Register online. Physical. Occupational. Financial. Intellectual. Social. Explore the eight dimensions of wellness through workshops and activities during Wellness Week. Learn about how physical, environmental, financial, intellectual, occupational, social and spiritual well-being connect to your student success.Sponsored by the Center for Student Involvement, Cross Cultural Centers, Kinesiology and Nutritional Science, Housing and Residential Life, Office for Students with Disabilities, Office of the Dean of Students, Student Health Center, University Library, University-Student Union, Xtreme Fitness, and student fees.

title: An Evening with Dr. Sengupta
description: Anita Sengupta is a rocket scientist and aerospace engineer who has been developing technologies that have enabled the exploration of Mars, asteroids, and deep space for over 20 years. Join us for a discussion about NASA's Cold Atom Lab Experiment, hyperloop technology and much more.

title: Women's History Month In-Class Series: Domestic Violence
description: Join us for a series of events presented by Cal State LA faculty and the Cross Cultural Centers that highlight the stories, challenges and triumphs of women in the U.S. and around the world. Ruzanna Karmiryan, professor of SOC 3410, will have a guest speaker presenting. Due to the nature of public programming, dates, times, locations or program descriptions/program content are subject to change or cancellation.

description: Join us for a series of events presented by Cal State LA faculty and the Cross Cultural Centers that highlight the stories, challenges and triumphs of women in the U.S. and around the world. Chris Endy, professor of HIST 4780, will be presenting. Due to the nature of public programming, dates, times, locations or program descriptions/program content are subject to change or cancellation.

description: This day is all about women empowerment! Come out to meet and mingle with our very special guest speakers and celebrate women leading the way both on and off campus. For more information and speaker bios, visit the event webpage .

title: ASI Voting Party Part 2

description: Your Voice, Your Vote! Vote online for your student representatives through the Cal State LA GET system. Check your Cal State LA email for more details regarding the ASI General Election. For more information about the candidates, events and news, visit the ASI election webpage .

title: 38th LAUSD Conservatory of Fine Arts Children's Exhibition Reception
description: The Los Angeles Unified School District Fine Arts Program celebrates its 38th year at the Cal State LA Fine Arts Gallery. The free 24-week program at Cal State LA is sponsored by the LAUSD Gifted/Talented Performing Arts Programs. The exhibition will be open from April 6-13, and a reception will be on April 6 from 10 a.m. until 1 p.m.
location: Cal State LA Fine Arts Gallery

title: You Better Werk: Small Talk and Navigating the Heteronormative Agenda
description: Small talk can make or break a potential connection. This professional development workshop from the Cross Cultural Centers highlights how to build lasting professional relationships as an LGBTQIA+ employee navigating the heteronormative agenda.
location: Pasadena Room, Third Floor, University-Student Union

description: Come get CPR certified! Learn about the importance of CPR and how it can save lives. Spots are limited. Please RSVP through the Center for Student Involvement office, U-SU 204.

title: Fundamentals of Interviewing
description: Up your interview game to the professional level. Career counselors will share tips on how to respond to different types of interview questions and what to avoid in the professional job interview.

description: Did you know that 87 percent of recruiters find LinkedIn most effective when vetting job candidates during the hiring process? Get advice from your career counselors as we discuss what you can do on LinkedIn to develop a professional online presence, explore careers, grow your network and enhance your industry knowledge.

title: Golden Eagle Pride 3K
description: Are you ready to soar and show your campus spirit? Join us for the Golden Eagle Pride 3K Run/Walk! Register beginning Feb. 20 by visiting the Center for Student Involvement at the University-Student Union, Room 204. Register as an individual or form teams by donating five nonperishable food items to support the University's Food Pantry! The team with the most donated items will win the Golden Eagle Spirit Award. The first 200 people to register will recieve the official Golden Eagle Pride T-Shirt along with a commemorative medal! Sponsored by the Center for Student Involvement, Cross Cultural Centers, Kinesiology and Nutritional Science, Housing and Residential Life, Office for Students with Disabilities, Office of the Dean of Students, Student Health Center, University Library, University-Student Union, Xtreme Fitness, and student fees.

title: Pantry to Plate
description: Recharge with Pantry to Plate after the Golden Eagle Pride 3K. Pantry to Plate is a cooking series featuring the Food Pantry’s mobile kitchen. Learn to make easy and healthy meals using foods commonly distributed at the pantry. Enjoy free samples while supplies last! Pantry to Plate is a collaboration between the Office of the Dean of Students and the Center for Student Involvment. Find more information regarding food and housing security initiatives on the Dean of Students webpage. Sponsored by the Center for Student Involvement, Cross Cultural Centers, Kinesiology and Nutritional Science, Housing and Residential Life, Office for Students with Disabilities, Office of the Dean of Students, Student Health Center, University Library, University-Student Union, Xtreme Fitness, and student fees.

description: Hop away the hunger by donating nonperishable food items to the University Food Pantry on Mondays from 11 a.m. to 1 p.m. and 3 to 5 p.m during our April food drive running until April 29. For more information, visit the food pantry webpage .
location: University-Student Union, Third Floor, Food Pantry

title: Basic Needs Resource and Service Fair
description: Critical to student success at Cal State LA, the Basic Needs Initiative takes a holistic look at students’ well-being both inside and outside the classroom, from housing and food security to mental health. We’re working together to find better ways to support our students and the serve the greater Los Angeles community. Attend to find out more about on-campus resources and involvement and service opportunities.

title: Native American Heritage Series: You're on Indian Land
description: Join the Cross Cultural Centers for a poster screen-printing workshop with Tongva musician Kelly Caballero who will explore what it means to exist on unceded Tongva lands, where Cal State LA and much of L.A. sits now.
location: Los Angeles Room, Third Floor, University-Student Union

title: Social Identity Exploration: You're on Indian Land
description: Deepen the awareness and understanding of yourself through the Cross Cultural Centers' Social Identity Exploration Series. Explore who you are and how your multifaceted identities exist in different spaces. Join us for a poster screen-printing workshop with Tongva musician Kelly Caballero and a conversation to explore what it means to exist on unceded Tongva lands.
location: University-Student Union, Third Floor, Los Angeles Room

title: Farmers Market
description: Join us for spring semester markets showcasing various food, drinks and crafts from independent vendors and farmers in the Greater Los Angeles Area. Don't forget your reusable bags! You'll need them to carry around those organic and locally grown fruits, breads, honey and more.

location: Los Angeles Room A, Third Floor, University-Student Union

title: Greek Awards Banquet: Uplifting Community
description: Join us as we recognize and celebrate the contributions and accomplishments of our Greek chapters as well as their student leaders and advisors. To reserve your spot, please call the Center for Student Involvement at (323) 343-5110 by April 16.
location: Golden Eagle Building, Third Floor, Golden Eagle Ballroom 3

title: International Coffee Break
description: Informal social gathering for international and study abroad students.
location: International Lobby, Golden Eagle Building, Room 217

title: Food Culture Day
description: We all have a favorite dish that connects us to our past, something that has a special, personal value to us. The passing down of recipes from generation to generation can be a symbol of ethnic pride and cultural preservation. Join us at Food Culture Day to share food and tell stories that celebrate our unique experiences.

title: Happy Hour at The Pit
description: Join us for free popcorn, games and great music in the Pit! Hang out with old friends or make some new ones.

title: Happy Hour at The Pit
description: Join us for free popcorn, games and great music in the Pit! Hang out with old friends or make some new ones.

title: Billiards Tournament
description: Show off your billiards skills and compete to win a cash prize! There will be free food and beverages while supplies last. Sign up in the Pit by April 11 to compete.

title: Health Professions Fair
description: The first Health Professions Fair, hosted by the Health Careers Advisement Office, will feature various health profession schools and programs. Learn more about health professions and meet representatives from their programs.

title: Eating Healthy on a Budget
description: Join us for a four-part workshop series based on current dietary and physical activity guidelines. Healthy snacks will be provided at every workshop* and a Certificate of Completion is given to participants who attend all four sessions. *while supplies last

title: I've Got a LinkedIn Profile, Now What?
description: Unsure of how to professionally network on LinkedIn? Join your career counselors as we discuss networking in person and online, and using LinkedIn to meet new people in your chosen major or career path, join industry-specific groups, connect with company insiders and stay in touch with your professional community.

title: Wellness Workshop: Sex, Consent and You
description: What is affirmative consent? Is it rape if someone says "no" after sex has begun? Can a person who is under the influence of alcohol or other drugs give legal consent for sex? Does "no" ever mean "yes"? Join us for this interactive exploration of consent and what it takes to avoid sexual misconduct and violence.

title: Men of Color Success Network: After Graduation
description: The end of the academic year is near. For many, that means graduating and moving into the world. We will discuss goals, hopes and decision-making for our post-graduation lives.
location: Alhambra Room, Third Floor, University-Student Union

title: LGBTQIA+ Allyship Training
description: Learn foundational information about sex, gender identity, gender expression and sexual orientation. Examine your knowledge and beliefs and begin critiquing systems that are harmful to LGBTQIA+ people. Register online on the training webpage . The location of the event will be shared with those who register in advance.

title: Choosing a Major: Charting a Career
description: Unsure about your major or thinking about changing or adding majors? Career counselors will help you determine how your interests, skills, values and personality link with career pathways and how exploring career pathways can lead to a meaningful major choice.

title: Pantry to Plate
description: Stop by for some spring cookin’! Pantry to Plate is a cooking series featuring the Food Pantry’s mobile kitchen. Learn to make easy and healthy meals using foods commonly distributed at the pantry. Enjoy free samples while supplies last! Pantry to Plate is a collaboration between the Office of the Dean of Students and the Center for Student Involvment. description: Join us for free popcorn, games and great music in the Pit! Hang out with old friends or make some new ones.

description: Hop away the hunger by donating nonperishable food items to the University Food Pantry on Mondays from 11 a.m. to 1 p.m. and 3 to 5 p.m during our April food drive running until April 29. For more information, visit the food pantry webpage .
location: University-Student Union, Third Floor, Food Pantry

title: 2019 Conference on Mexican Muralists: Their Art, Their Lives, and Their Times
description: This international conference consists of lectures and panel presentations by distinguished scholars from Mexico and the United States on the art, lives and times of Mexican mural masters Orozco, Rivera, and Siqueiros. The conference addresses the work of these muralists from different perspectives, including aesthetics, biography and the utopian ideals that defined the artistic and political scope of Mexican muralism in the 20th century. This conference is free and open to the public. For more information, visit the event website or contact faculty member Roberto Cantú at rcantu@calstatela.edu.

title: Eagles Care: Hathaway-Sycamores
description: Interested in working with children and families? Come visit Hathaway-Sycamores to learn about their organization and how they support families and youth. Transportation and lunch are provided.

title: Mind Matters Speaker Series: A Talk and Book Signing with Julie M. Albright
description: As part of the Mind Matters Speaker Series, the University community is invited to a talk and book signing with sociologist Julie M. Albright for her new book, Left to Their Own Devices: How Digital Natives Are Reshaping the American Dream.

title: Take Back The Night
description: Take Back the Night, hosted by the Cross Cultural Centers, will be full of opportunities to reclaim the campus as a safe space and break the silence on gender and sexual violence.

title: 10th Annual ASI Earth Day Celebration
description: Learn more about healthy living and sustainability efforts on campus. Stop by one of our sustainability info booths and exhibits, grab a bite from an eco-conscious food truck or participate in one of our giveaways. Visit the ASI event webpage for more information.

title: Hop Away the Hunger: April Food Drive
description: Hop away the hunger by donating nonperishable food items to the University Food Pantry on Mondays from 11 a.m. to 1 p.m. and 3 to 5 p.m during our April food drive running until April 29. For more information, visit the food pantry webpage .
location: University-Student Union, Third Floor, Food Pantry

title: CLS 50th Anniversary: ¡Presente! Transnational and Local Womyn Writers of Color
description: Come listen to the poesía and prose of four womyn writers whose verses traverse local and international fronteras. From Centro América to México to Los Angeles and beyond, ¡Aquí estamos!
location: Los Angeles Room, Third Floor, University-Student Union

title: Geosciences Career Day and Open House
description: Come see where the jobs are in the geosciences field! This is a great opportunity for you to meet with representatives from federal and state government agencies, cities, the Jet Propulsion Laboratory, Southern California Edison, GIS mapmakers, geologists, hydrologists and private companies in the Los Angeles area. You can also learn about the great training programs in GIS, remote sensing and spatial analysis offered by the Department of Geosciences and Environment. Refreshments will be served.​

title: Job Search Strategies
description: Have you ever submitted dozens of résumés yet never heard back? Don’t stress; re-strategize. Career counselors will introduce how to develop a system for finding work.

title: Résumé Basics
description: What should I include in a professional résumé? Career counselors will show you how to write an effective summary, describe skills developed through coursework, detail work and internship experiences, include awards and volunteer activities and present this information the way hiring managers prefer.

title: Study Abroad This Summer
description: Learn about study abroad opportunities and adventures during summer 2019.

title: Latinidad Negra, Latinidad Indígena: Writing Workshop with Alan Pelaez
description: Join Afro-Indigenous queer poet Alan Pelaez for Latinidad Negra, Latinidad Indígena , a writing workshop that centers around experiences of indigenous and Black Latinxs.
location: Los Angeles Room BC, Third Floor, University-Student Union

title: Social Identity Exploration: Latinidad Negra, Latinidad Indígena
description: Deepen the awareness and understanding of yourself through the Cross Cultural Centers' Social Identity Exploration Series. Explore who you are and how your multifaceted identities exist in different spaces. Join Afro-Indigenous queer poet Alan Pelaez for a writing workshop that centers experiences of Indigenous and Black Latinxs.
location: University-Student Union, Third Floor, Los Angeles Room BC

title: Queer Disability Workshop
description: Queerness is a spectrum that comes in many different forms. Join this workshop and explore the lives and experiences of folks who identify as Queer and disabled.
location: Alhambra Room, Third Floor, University-Student Union

title: Third Annual Mental and Behavioral Health Conference
description: "Connection of the Mind and Body: Impact of the Current Social and Political Climate," is the third annual Mental and Behavioral Health Conference. The conference provides training and professional development opportunities for students, practitioners and community members. Our third annual conference seeks to provide attendees with critical understandings and practical knowledge that can be used to enrich their scholarship, service provision, and relationships while also inspiring thoughtful and intentional community action. In this contemporary moment, we are especially concerned with how social and political climates directly affect our mental health and well-being. From immigration law to climate change, the contentious social issues of our time have the greatest effect on the most vulnerable and marginalized populations in society. Our theme this year is a call to counselors, psychologists, educators, scholars and practitioners to explore connections between mental health and the socio-political environment. Register online for the conference. *Space is not guaranteed for registrations at the door on the day of the event. Last year's conference was at capacity. Conference scholarships are available to Cal State LA students online at 2019 Mental and Behavioral Health Conference Scholarship Application. More event details can be found on the Mental and Behavioral Health Conference webpage.

title: Table Tennis Tournament
description: Show off your table tennis skills and compete to win a cash prize! There will be free food and beverages while supplies last. Sign-up in the Pit by April 18 to compete.

title: Lesbian Visibility Day
description: Come celebrate the lesbians who have paved a way for the Queer community with the Cross Cultural Centers. We will examine lesbian representation in media, honor activists and celebrities from the past to the present.
location: Los Angeles Room AB, Third Floor, University-Student Union

title: Fly Well Student Conference Day 1: Leadership
description: The Student Leadership retreat is here to propel you to new heights. This two-day conference is planned to intentionally give you every opportunity to set goals, plan accordingly and achieve them.
location: Golden Eagle Ballrooms and University-Student Union

title: The Making of the Play: The Houseguest from XinJiang
description: Join us as we explore the making of the original play, The Houseguest from XinJiang, written by ChorSwang Ngin, professor of anthropology at Cal State LA, and C.Y. Lee, featuring storylines of encounters between East Asian Muslim exchange students and a community in Southern California.
location: Los Angeles Room BC, Third Floor, University-Student Union

description: Join us for a four-part workshop series based on current dietary and physical activity guidelines. Healthy snacks will be provided at every workshop* and a Certificate of Completion is given to participants who attend all four sessions. *while supplies last

title: Wellness Workshop: Step Up!
description: An interactive presentation that empowers students with the skills to safely intervene when a friend, family member or peer is in a situation where their health could be at risk. Bystander intervention can help prevent sexual assault, hazing, suicide, relationship violence and the consequences of alcohol intoxication. Knowing how to step up and diffuse a difficult situation while staying safe is a necessary tool everyone should have!

title: Optional Practical Training Workshop
description: F-1 international students are invited to learn about Optional Practical Training (OPT) that will allow them to work in the U.S. after graduation.

title: Hop Away the Hunger: April Food Drive
description: Hop away the hunger by donating nonperishable food items to the University Food Pantry on Mondays from 11 a.m. to 1 p.m. and 3 to 5 p.m during our April food drive running until April 29. For more information, visit the food pantry webpage .
